talks.title: En route to better code
talks.description:
The objective of this talk is to revisit the clean-code guidelines of the Software Craftsmanship movement, this time with a focus on a functional programming language like Scala. 
I will talk from my experience, what practices have worked (or not) to better achieve:
- Readable and maintainable code, because no programmer is an island
- Reusable and modular software components
- Robust and testable programs
  
In this talk I want to talk This talk aims to show how with good code we can better achieve what is already possible with Scala:
talks.abstract:
Reduced complexity, enhanced productivity, robust programs. Such are the promises of Functional Programming. But is it automatic? Can we be sure that only by adopting a language like Scala our success is guaranteed?
Let's revisit well known good practices, focusing on FP and in the Scala language.
